summary: This is an email chain from June 14, 2019, where a federal prosecutor informs colleagues they are heading to Bermuda with family and will be out of the office, noting that a draft Epstein prosecution memo and indictment will likely be ready before their return. It shows internal DOJ communication about the Epstein case preparation.

persons.name: (USANYS)
persons.context: Appears as the sender of an email discussing travel plans and indicating that a draft Epstein prosecution memo and indictment will be ready before their return from vacation.

events.title: Email about Epstein case preparation
events.description: A federal prosecutor emails colleagues about upcoming travel and mentions that a draft Epstein prosecution memo and indictment will likely be ready before they return.

events.title: Prosecutor's travel to Bermuda
events.description: The prosecutor mentions heading to Bermuda with family the morning after the email.

keyFacts: The email is dated June 14, 2019, shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
A federal prosecutor indicates that a draft prosecution memo and indictment for Epstein will likely be ready before their return from vacation.
The communication shows internal DOJ preparation for prosecuting Epstein around June 2019.
